meanings.definition: The practice of preaching through television broadcasts.
meanings.sent1: Many people enjoy watching televangelisms on TV.
meanings.sent2: Televangelisms can reach a wide audience through television.
meanings.sent3: The family gathered around the TV to watch the televangelisms together.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like televangelisms, spreading far and wide through the screens.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of televangelisms illuminated the living room with hope.

meanings.definition: The messages or teachings delivered by televangelists.
meanings.sent1: The televangelisms shared important lessons with the viewers.
meanings.sent2: Viewers eagerly awaited the televangelisms for spiritual guidance.
meanings.sent3: The televangelisms inspired many to reflect on their beliefs.
meanings.sent4: His words were like televangelisms, echoing in the hearts of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The power of televangelisms resonated with those seeking faith.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon of using television as a platform for evangelism.
meanings.sent1: Televangelisms have transformed how people engage with religion.
meanings.sent2: The rise of televangelisms has changed the landscape of evangelism.
meanings.sent3: Some find comfort in the familiar glow of televangelisms on screen.
meanings.sent4: In a digital age, televangelisms bridge the gap between faith and technology.
meanings.sent5: The reach of televangelisms extends beyond borders, uniting believers worldwide.
